messages.message:
but i think it’s not just the “apply refiner IBOCR”. it’s “the IBOCR so far” — and it’s very reasonable to think users would download the output of the last step thinking it’s a summary, then come across the same problem I did. And the field still has useful data (raw OCR)— why overwrite it with a `.value()` dump of refined_phrases?

Are you good with changing this behavior and keeping the text field the same @dlluncor ? we can check with Hari/Sudeep to see if SC uses the text field once it’s been changed in this way (they’d be the only candidate and even then, unlikely).
Yep sounds good. And check with @shaunak some ibocr is going away anyhow
Yea but if this is an explicit set then I don't think the problem would be fixed by ibdoc. It would propogate to it. Correct me if I'm wrong @shaunak
Explicit set => someone calls "set text" on the ibocr record
Yes, it doesn’t matter whether you use IBOCR or IBDOC.
sg — will scope out the issue and get it into nov release (not today’s code release). this will help make refiner output IBOCRs more usable for mere mortals :slightly_smiling_face:
